thread.title: Texas basketball news: Camden Heide putback sends Longhorns fans into a frenzy
thread.title_full: Texas basketball news: Camden Heide putback sends Longhorns fans into a frenzy

author: Josh Davis
title: Texas basketball news: Camden Heide putback sends Longhorns fans into a frenzy
text:
Texas Longhorns basketball fans are quickly finding out just how electrifying Camden Heide can be. In a high-scoring showdown at the Maui Invitational, the Longhorns outpaced the No. 23 ranked NC State Wolfpack by a score of 102-97, fueled by explosive offense, timely shooting, and a jaw-dropping putback slam from Heide that swung the momentum and ignited both his teammates and the fanbase.
The Longhornsâ€™ official menâ€™s basketball team posted a highlight of the jaw-dropping putback slam that sent the bench and crowd into a frenzy.
â€œTHAT'S CAM HEIDE ðŸ¤˜ðŸ”¥â€
THAT'S CAM HEIDE ðŸ¤˜ðŸ”¥
[#HookEm][pic.twitter.com/3h0nr9d0zo]â€” Texas Menâ€™s Basketball (@TexasMBB)
[November 27, 2025]
Heide, a transfer from Purdue, finished the night with 11 points, showcasing his athleticism and ability to energize the team. While the dunk made waves online, it wasnâ€™t the only highlight. Jordan Pope led the way with 28 points, knocking down seven three-pointers. Chendall Weaver chipped in 17 points and 8 rebounds, while Dailyn Swain filled the stat sheet with 14 points, 6 boards, and 7 assists.
Texas dominated early, building a 15-point lead in the first half. NC State responded, briefly grabbing a 71-70 lead with under eight minutes to play. However, the Longhorns closed strong behind efficient shootingâ€”50 percent from deep and nearly 85 percent from the line.
Heideâ€™s latest slam is already drawing comparisons to his iconic putback from the 2024 NCAA title game when he was still at Purdue. That dunk was named ESPNâ€™s No. 1 play of the night and solidified his reputation as a high-flying threat.
Now in burnt orange, the junior forward is delivering that same high-flying energy night after nightâ€”and Longhorns fans canâ€™t get enough, especially as his highlight plays continue to energize teammates, fire up crowds, and add a serious spark to Texas basketballâ€™s early-season momentum.
